Can Arc<QuorumCert> contain interior mutability that violates Sync requirements, causing undefined behavior in multi-threaded validation? (High)

[File: aptos-core/consensus/consensus-types/src/order_vote_proposal.rs] [Struct: OrderVoteProposal] [Epoch Boundary Attack] Can an OrderVoteProposal be created during epoch transition (block_info.next_epoch_state.is_some()) with a quorum_cert from the old epoch, causing validators to mix epoch state and violate safety? [File: aptos-core/consensus/consensus-types/src/order_vote_proposal.rs] [Struct: OrderVoteProposal] [Round Gap Exploitation] Can an OrderVoteProposal skip multiple rounds (e.g., round 5 to round 10) without proper timeout certificates, bypassing the round progression safety rules? (High)

[File: aptos-core/consensus/consensus-types/src/order_vote_proposal.rs] [Struct: OrderVoteProposal] [Backward Round Attack] Can an OrderVoteProposal with block.round() < safety_data.one_chain_round be created and partially processed before being rejected, wasting validation resources? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/consensus/consensus-types/src/order_vote_proposal.rs] [Struct: OrderVoteProposal] [Optimistic Block Attack] Can an OrderVoteProposal for an optimistic block (block.is_opt_block()) be processed differently than normal blocks, enabling attacks that bypass standard validation? [File: aptos-core/consensus/consensus-types/src/order_vote_proposal.rs] [Struct: OrderVoteProposal] [Transaction Version Gap] Can block_info.version be set to a value that skips transaction versions (e.g., from version 100 to 110), allowing hiding of transactions or state changes? (Critical)
